learningPath.title: Learning Path
learningPath.subtitle: Follow this structured path to master agentic AI patterns from fundamentals to advanced production systems.
learningPath.congratulationsDesc: You've mastered all 21 agentic design patterns. You're now ready to build production-grade AI agent systems.
learningPath.readyToBeginDesc: Start with Chapter 1 and learn the fundamental pattern of prompt chaining. Each chapter builds on the previous ones.

1.name: Foundations
1.description: Build your first agent with basic patterns. Learn the fundamental building blocks that every AI agent system uses.

2.name: Tool Mastery
2.description: Empower agents with tools and planning capabilities. Transform passive assistants into action-oriented agents.

3.name: Infrastructure
3.description: Build robust agent infrastructure with memory, adaptation, and external integrations.

4.name: Robustness
4.description: Handle errors gracefully and integrate human oversight. Build agents that work reliably in the real world.

5.name: Advanced Systems
5.description: Master advanced patterns for production-grade multi-agent systems with safety and evaluation.

introduction.title: What Are Agentic AI Systems?
introduction.subtitle: Before diving into the 21 design patterns, let's understand what AI agents are and why they matter.
introduction.whatIsAgentDesc: An AI agent is a software system that uses a Large Language Model (LLM) to autonomously perform tasks, make decisions, and interact with the world.
simpleLLMPoints: You ask a question, it responds
Cannot take actions in the real world
introduction.analogy: Think of it this way: a chatbot is like a knowledgeable friend who can only talk. An agent is like a personal assistant who can research, plan, execute tasks, and get things done.

llm.definition: The AI "brain" that understands and generates text. Examples: GPT-4, Claude, Gemini, Llama.

prompt.definition: The instructions or questions you give to an LLM. Good prompts lead to better results.

tool.definition: A function the agent can call to interact with the worldâ€”search the web, run code, call APIs, etc.

chain.definition: A sequence of LLM calls or operations connected together, where output of one becomes input of the next.

token.definition: How LLMs measure text. Roughly 4 characters = 1 token. Important for costs and context limits.

introduction.frameworksDesc: The code examples use popular Python frameworks for building AI agents:

langchain.name: LangChain
langchain.description: The most popular framework for building LLM applications. Provides tools, chains, and agent abstractions.

langgraph.name: LangGraph
langgraph.description: LangChain's framework for building stateful, multi-step agent workflows as graphs.

adk.name: Google ADK
adk.description: Agent Development Kit for building agents with Google's Gemini models.

crewai.name: CrewAI
crewai.description: Framework for orchestrating multiple AI agents working together as a "crew".

shouldKnowPoints: General AI/ML awareness (helpful but not required)
needPoints: An API key from OpenAI, Anthropic, or Google
introduction.quickStartDesc: Let's get you running your first AI agent in under 5 minutes. Copy and paste this code:
introduction.step2: Set your API key (get one from
introduction.step3: Run your first chain (save as agent.py)
introduction.quickStartSuccess: That's it! You just ran your first LangChain agent. Now you're ready to learn the patterns that make agents powerful.
introduction.whyPatternsDesc: Just like software engineering has design patterns (Singleton, Factory, Observer...), AI agent development has its own patterns that solve common problems:

promptChaining.problem: Complex tasks that need multiple steps

routing.problem: Directing queries to the right handler

toolUse.problem: Letting agents interact with external systems

introduction.patternsSummary: These 21 patterns give you a toolkit to build robust, production-ready AI systems.
introduction.readyToStartDesc: Begin with Chapter 1: Prompt Chainingâ€”the foundational pattern that everything else builds on.
